intro: Cerastium semidecandrum subsp. macilentum, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, characterized by its small, showy flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically forms dense mats on rocky or sandy soils, often in alpine or arctic environments. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals and numerous stamens, and it blooms in late spring to early summer. The subspecies macilentum is distinguished by its slender stems and reduced leaf size compared to other members of the species.
